title: 17 Kenyan schoolchildren burn to death in dormitory fire
content: Arson is often used as a tool of protest by Kenyan students over poor living conditions or harsh teachers.
summary: Arson is often used as a tool of protest by Kenyan students over poor living conditions or harsh teachers.

title: D.C. lobbyists battle over future of the Orthodox Church in Ukraine
content: Critics say Kyiv is attacking religious freedom in its efforts to break the Ukrainian Orthodox Church’s ties with Moscow. Ukraine says it’s acting in self-defense.
summary: Critics say Kyiv is attacking religious freedom in its efforts to break the Ukrainian Orthodox Church’s ties with Moscow. Ukraine says it’s acting in self-defense.

title: Germany’s firewall against the far right isn’t working
content: Recent elections in Germany show the limits of the nation’s statist efforts to stamp out far-right extremism and ultranationalism.
summary: Recent elections in Germany show the limits of the nation’s statist efforts to stamp out far-right extremism and ultranationalism.

title: Super Typhoon Yagi, one of 2024’s most powerful storms, heads toward China
content: Packing winds of at least 150 mph, Yagi is the planet’s second-strongest storm this year. It is expected to hit the southern Chinese provinces of Hainan and Guangdong.
summary: Packing winds of at least 150 mph, Yagi is the planet’s second-strongest storm this year. It is expected to hit the southern Chinese provinces of Hainan and Guangdong.

title: Blinken visits Haiti in show of U.S. support for struggling government
content: Blinken’s trip to Haiti was a gamble for the Biden administration, calling attention to an unresolved crisis that, if mismanaged, could cause a migration surge.
summary: Blinken’s trip to Haiti was a gamble for the Biden administration, calling attention to an unresolved crisis that, if mismanaged, could cause a migration surge.

title: Rome floats plan to charge tourists at Trevi Fountain
content: Italy’s most famous fountain has an overtourism problem, but locals say restricting access might not be the best solution.
summary: Italy’s most famous fountain has an overtourism problem, but locals say restricting access might not be the best solution.

title: How other countries have responded to gun violence, attacks at schools
content: International responses to school shootings and gun violence vary widely, with some countries enacting strict laws.
summary: International responses to school shootings and gun violence vary widely, with some countries enacting strict laws.

title: Venezuela detains U.S. sailor, officials say
content: The incident occurred amid an increasingly adversarial relationship between Washington and Caracas.
summary: The incident occurred amid an increasingly adversarial relationship between Washington and Caracas.

title: Nicaragua frees 135 political prisoners after secret U.S. negotiations
content: Among those released are 13 members of a Texas-based evangelical organization. The prisoners were flown to Guatemala and can apply for U.S. residency.
summary: Among those released are 13 members of a Texas-based evangelical organization. The prisoners were flown to Guatemala and can apply for U.S. residency.

title: The Philadelphi Corridor, an Israel-Gaza cease-fire obstacle, explained
content: Israel’s demand to control the Philadelphi Corridor — a narrow strip of no man’s land — is a key issue in Gaza cease-fire talks.
summary: Israel’s demand to control the Philadelphi Corridor — a narrow strip of no man’s land — is a key issue in Gaza cease-fire talks.

title: France’s Macron picks Michel Barnier as prime minister to end deadlock
content: The French president named Michel Barnier, the European Union’s former Brexit negotiator, nearly two months after elections that kept the far right from power but resulted in political deadlock.
summary: The French president named Michel Barnier, the European Union’s former Brexit negotiator, nearly two months after elections that kept the far right from power but resulted in political deadlock.

title: Futebol-crazed Brazil is falling for another kind of football
content: How the NFL, ESPN and Gisele Bündchen made Brazil the league’s largest market outside North America.
summary: How the NFL, ESPN and Gisele Bündchen made Brazil the league’s largest market outside North America.

title: German police fatally shoot gunman near Israeli Consulate in Munich
content: The attacker fired several shots near the consulate and was killed by police. The incident occurred on the anniversary of the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre.
summary: The attacker fired several shots near the consulate and was killed by police. The incident occurred on the anniversary of the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre.

title: Ukraine taps former ambassador Andrii Sybiha as top diplomat
content: The replacement of prominent Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba comes amid a wide-ranging government reshuffle ahead of the president’s trip to the United States.
summary: The replacement of prominent Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba comes amid a wide-ranging government reshuffle ahead of the president’s trip to the United States.

title: Woman testifies husband drugged her for years, recruited dozens to rape her
content: The alleged victim told a court in Avignon, France, that her husband and the 51 other men accused in the case of raping her while she was unconscious destroyed her identity.
summary: The alleged victim told a court in Avignon, France, that her husband and the 51 other men accused in the case of raping her while she was unconscious destroyed her identity.

title: Russia dismisses charges of election meddling; Putin claims he backs Harris
content: Despite calling the U.S. charges of interference nonsense, Russian officials have publicly celebrated attempts to influence the American public.
summary: Despite calling the U.S. charges of interference nonsense, Russian officials have publicly celebrated attempts to influence the American public.

title: War within a war: Israel takes aim at Hamas militants in Lebanon
content: Officials and experts in Lebanon say Israel’s assassination campaign against Palestinian militants has brought Hamas and Hezbollah closer together.
summary: Officials and experts in Lebanon say Israel’s assassination campaign against Palestinian militants has brought Hamas and Hezbollah closer together.

title: Ugandan Olympic runner dies after being set on fire by ex-boyfriend
content: Rebecca Cheptegei is the third high-profile athlete to be killed in a domestic violence incident in Kenya.
summary: Rebecca Cheptegei is the third high-profile athlete to be killed in a domestic violence incident in Kenya.

title: New Zealand’s Maori celebrate new era as 27-year-old queen is anointed
content: Nga Wai Hono i te Po Paki takes on the ceremonial role amid heightened tensions with the conservative government, which is rolling back “race-based” policies.
summary: Nga Wai Hono i te Po Paki takes on the ceremonial role amid heightened tensions with the conservative government, which is rolling back “race-based” policies.

title: A tax on tourism? To visit these destinations, it’ll cost you extra.
content: New Zealand announced it is nearly tripling its tourist tax, joining places from Venice to Bali, Indonesia, that are trying to offset overtourism.
summary: New Zealand announced it is nearly tripling its tourist tax, joining places from Venice to Bali, Indonesia, that are trying to offset overtourism.

title: China pledges $50B and 1M jobs in renewed outreach to Africa
content: Chinese leader Xi Jinping, seeking contrast with Washington, said Beijing offered Africa modernization without Western-style “suffering.”
summary: Chinese leader Xi Jinping, seeking contrast with Washington, said Beijing offered Africa modernization without Western-style “suffering.”

title: Hostage killings and irreconcilable demands complicate cease-fire talks
content: Frustrated mediators are now putting together what they have described as a “final offer,” but significant concessions on both sides are needed for agreement, said a U.S. official.
summary: Frustrated mediators are now putting together what they have described as a “final offer,” but significant concessions on both sides are needed for agreement, said a U.S. official.

title: Netanyahu’s conflicting messages confuse cease-fire talks, officials say
content: Netanyahu this week said Israel would not withdraw from the Gaza-Egypt border, while his chief negotiator told mediators the military would eventually pull out.
summary: Netanyahu this week said Israel would not withdraw from the Gaza-Egypt border, while his chief negotiator told mediators the military would eventually pull out.

title: Breakdancer Raygun responds to backlash after infamous Olympic performance
content: The Australian academic said she has struggled with her mental health and worried about her and her loved ones’ safety, but that dancing remains her “medicine.”
summary: The Australian academic said she has struggled with her mental health and worried about her and her loved ones’ safety, but that dancing remains her “medicine.”

title: All 72 deaths in U.K.’s Grenfell Tower fire avoidable, final report says
content: The burning of Grenfell Tower and the deaths of dozens horrified Britain and put renewed scrutiny on building codes and safety measures.
summary: The burning of Grenfell Tower and the deaths of dozens horrified Britain and put renewed scrutiny on building codes and safety measures.

title: Zelensky reshuffles cabinet at key moment in war and ahead of U.S. trip
content: The reorganization of the administration comes as Russia unleashes a new wave of aerial attacks on Ukrainian cities, including one on Lviv that killed seven overnight.
summary: The reorganization of the administration comes as Russia unleashes a new wave of aerial attacks on Ukrainian cities, including one on Lviv that killed seven overnight.

title: Why everyone is suddenly worried about Mexico’s democracy
content: President Andres Manuel López Obrador, in his final month in office, is pushing legislation that would send appointed federal judges home and let voters elect their replacements.
summary: President Andres Manuel López Obrador, in his final month in office, is pushing legislation that would send appointed federal judges home and let voters elect their replacements.

title: Spanish singles found a new dating strategy. It’s in the fruit aisle.
content: The method, which grew popular on TikTok, involves placing a pineapple in your cart at the Mercadona grocery store at night. People say it’s a reaction against dating apps.
summary: The method, which grew popular on TikTok, involves placing a pineapple in your cart at the Mercadona grocery store at night. People say it’s a reaction against dating apps.
